alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Wrangell; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 21 at 12:07AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Central Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Petersburg, Kake, Port Alexander, And Wrangell. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An atmospheric river is bringing heavy rainfall in the range of 2 to 5 inches to the region through Thursday night. The heaviest rainfall will occur through Thursday morning. Minor flooding is possible Thursday and Thursday night, especially for smaller streams. Rainfall is expected to move out of the area Thursday night.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
